conclusion: Solve step by step using the v-t graph.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis; velocity starts at 2 m/s at t=1s and decreases linearly to -2 m/s at t=3s.
Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time; on a v-t graph, acceleration is the slope of the line.
At t=1s, velocity v1=2 m/s; at t=3s, velocity v2=-2 m/s.
Calculate change in velocity: Δv = v2 - v1 = -2 - 2 = -4 m/s.
Calculate change in time: Δt = t2 - t1 = 3 - 1 = 2 s.
Interpret result: acceleration is -2 m/s², indicating deceleration at a constant rate in the opposite direction of initial velocity.
Final answer: acceleration of the particle during the time interval from 1 to 3 seconds is -2 m/s².
